abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows: Project
            outcome is satisfactory; sustainability is likely;
            institutional development impact is modest; and the
            performances of both the Bank and the Borrower are
            satisfactory.  Lessons learned concerned Project Design and
            Policy Implications. In this case the lesson was that Public
            transport projects should be designed to survive in any
            environment, centralized or decentralized.   institutional
            capacity should be assessed prior to the start of project
            implementation.  The project should have been designed with
            on lending at the Bank nominal rate (plus the Banobras fee)
            for major corridor improvements and matching grants for
            other project components. This would have represented a more
            equitable treatment within the transport sector. The project
            did not focus enough on the development of an appropriate
            M&S to measure outputs, outcomes and impacts. Attention
            should be paid to data collection in terms of urban
            transport project monitoring indicators and management.
            Developing a central data system in each city, as well as
            detailed implementation .
